TypeScript !!

( Sep 20, 2018 )

TypeScript is a mix of Java and JavaScript. It addes some features to JavaScript. Such as the variable type, namespace, module, and template. Especially it enforces the type of the variable. It has the compiler which compiles TypeScript to JavaScript and is being used more and more in Web app development, such as Angular. This is the notebook I prepared for TypeScript. Take a look.

React & Redux Part 1 !!

( Aug 27, 2018 )

React is the most popular tool to develop the front-end web application. Using React, any HTML element on the web page is implemented as a React component. It can be rendered in different ways based on different conditions.
Redux is the mechanism to pass data between React components. It can be used with React and Angular.
At the bottom is the link to my notebook about React and Redux. In the notebooks, you can find I was trying to build an email survey application. A user can use this application to create the survey email and send it to his customers. His customers can click the links in the email to respond. The feedbacks from his customers will be collected and reported to the user.
The following 3rd-party tools are used:
1, Stripe to do billing
2, SendGrid to do the email survey
3, MongoDB to record
4, Google OAuth to do the authentication

Node.js!!

( Aug 4, 2018 )

Node.js is for developing back-end or the web server. The front-end is developed using JavaScript+HTML+CSS, REACT or Angular. When a user accesses a website, the front-end will be downloaded into his PC and run in his browser. But the back-end is not downloaded to user's PC. The front-end needs to communicate with back-end.
Node.js is based on Chrome V8 Engine. It is an event-driven, non-blocking JavaScript Library.
I am using Visual Studio Code to develop the back-end. It is probably the best Node.js IDE. I come up with the following two notebooks which cover most of features of Node.js.
There are a lot of libraries/tools to use. I cannot list all of them here: Express, Mocha, Mongoose, Postman, Robo3T, Nodemon, SuperTest, Heroku, Moment, Socket.IO, Axios, Request, ...Please do go through the notebooks. You will see how powerful these libraries/tools are. One more thing: Chrome DevTools is the best tool to debug the Node.js code. Thanks to Google engineers.

Read The Artical

HTML and CSS!!

( June 21, 2018 )

JavaScript + HTML + CSS build the front-end of the web application.
Anyone who wants to learn about Web application, server and cloud should start from the front-end programming. Then you can move to the back-end and move to the cloud.
I have prepared the notebook about HTML and CSS programming. Hopefully it could be helpful to you.
In the notebook, at the beginning it is all about HTML and CSS grammars. And the later part describes how to build a project from scratch. What are the steps to take? How to design the website? How to implement the design? How to optimize your implementation? How to publish it to the public? How to maintain it? So if you follow the procedure, you should be able to build the practical websites. Good luck!

JavaScript!!

( June 9, 2018 )

Any technology required by Internet and its applications has a promising future. So do not stop learning these technologies.
JavaScript is the basic for internet application. Together with HTML and CSS, it forms the base for the frond-end applications of the Internet services. On top of this base we have node.js, React and other libraries and tools.
JavaScript has nothing to do with Java. But with ES2015 release, it does share some common features with Java, such as lambda. But compared to Java, JavaScript is simpler.
Here I would like to share a notebook I prepared. It covers almost all JavaScript features. In the last chapter it describes how to build a web application using JavaScript. I hope it could benefit you.

Read The Artical

Java!! Part 1

( May 27, 2018 )

Java is a standard High-Level Application language. It has been used widely just like C and C++. If you are a software engineer, no matter in which area you are working, it is a great benefit to you if you know Java programming.
I have come up with two notebooks about Java language. They cover almost all important topics/features about Java. They are created based on Java 8. And I am using IntelliJ IDEA which is one of the best Java IDE.
I hope both notebooks can serve as some kind of guideline books for you to keep and to refresh your knowledge on Java language from time to time.

Ethereum Web Application!!

( April 21, 2018 )

Here I have attached a link to a document about how to develop the web application for Ethereum network.
Take a look. If you are interested, take an online course. It is a little complex and maybe overwhelming to just read my document.
Why I talk about Ethereum?
Ethereum is the most popular Blockchain technology. We need to think about how to use it to build the business network for our customers and for our services.
Especially when IoT network is added with Blockchain, and maybe Machine learning, you will see a brand new market and technology. It will greatly change our daily life. It also means a lot of chances.
Thanks!!

Projects

I have finished the following projects. Some of them are the Front-end Web applications. Some of them are the application softwares.

Redd Angelo

Merman Manager Application

( Oct 29, 2018 )

This web application allows the user to add a merman with the name to one of the three places. The user can also remove a merman or edit the merman by changing his place.
Front-end is in React + MobX. Back-end is Node/Express + MongoDB.
You can find the source code here Please go to this web site to try it.

Angular Web Application Recipe

( Oct 11, 2018 )

This web application allows the user to create and edit recipes, and create a shopping list of ingredients for the recipe. It uses most of the important features Angular 6 provides.
The back-end is Firebase google server and its databse. The front-end is Angular.
You can find the source code here Please go to this web site to try it.

Ethereum Web Application CrowdCoin

( Sep 11, 2018 )

This web application allows the user to start a funding campaign for his project. The user can submit the request for spending the fund in contracting or purchasing. Investors will vote on the request. If it is passed, the user can transfer ether to the contractor or seller to start the operation.
The back-end is developed using Next.js, Next-Routes.js and Node.js. The front-end is React.
Two smart contracts are created and deployed in Rinkey test network. The back-end accesses the smart contract instances.
You can find the source code here Please go to this web site to try it.

Movie Query Application

( Sep 4, 2018 )

This web application allows the user to search the movie and see the details of the movie.
The back-end is developed using ASP.NET/C#. It connects to a MongoDB.
The front-end is React, Redux and Redux Form.
The application is framed using ASP.NET React/Redux Project template.
You can find the source code here Please go to this web site to try it.

Email Survey Application

( Aug 27, 2018 )

I created the email survey applcation. A user can use this application to create the survey email and send it to his customers. His customers can click the links in the email to respond. The feedbacks from his customers will be collected and reported to the user. It uses a lot of 3rd-party libs and tools, such as Stripe, SendGrid, Google OAuth and MongoDB. You can find the source code here Please go to this web site to try it. You can log in using your google account. And using the test credit card number to buy credits to test it.

Chat Application ⁄ Messaging System

( Aug 4, 2018 )

I created a chat platform for people to text each other in different chat rooms. It has the front-end and back-end. Back-end accesses Mongo DB. All messages are saved to the database. Front-end is implemented using JavaScript, HTML and CSS. Back-end is implemented using Node.js, Express, Socket.IO, Mongoose and tested using Mocha, Expect and SuperTest. You can find the source code here Please go to this web site to try it. You can open two web pages and talk with yourself.

www.keningren.com Website

( July 4, 2018 )

The website www.keningren.com is my current project. It was implemented using JavaScript, HTML and CSS. Both JavaScript DOM API and jQuery plugins are used.
During the implementation, I used npm and Webpack. The website is optimized for fast site speed and supports devices with different screen resolutions. And it is being maintained actively.
